Name: Prohibiting the use of plywood to secure vacant and abandoned buildings.
Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city building code, in relation to prohibiting the use of plywood to secure vacant and abandoned buildings

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
This Introduction was Filed (End of Session)

Summary: This bill would prohibit the use of plywood in sealing openings in vacant buildings. This prohibition is intended to prevent blight.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Article 216.1.2 of title 28 of chapter 2 of the New York city construction code is amended to read as follows:
      Vacant buildings. Any vacant building not continuously guarded or not sealed and kept secure against unauthorized entry shall have all openings sealed in a manner approved by the commissioner, but the use of plywood shall be prohibited in sealing such openings. [and] [i]It shall be the duty of the owner thereof promptly to make any repairs that may be necessary for the purpose of keeping such building sealed and secure.
ï¿½ 2. This local law takes effect immediately.
